# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/pygments/styles/__init__.py
@source-hash: 54c8f707b17a29fd
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:57:57Z

## Purpose
Style management module for the Pygments syntax highlighting library. Provides a centralized interface for discovering, loading, and accessing both built-in and plugin-based syntax highlighting styles.

## Key Components

### Style Mappings
- `STYLE_MAP` (L18): Deprecated dictionary mapping style names to `'submodule::classname'` format strings
- `_STYLE_NAME_TO_MODULE_MAP` (L21): Internal reverse mapping for efficient lookups, maps style names to (module_path, class_name) tuples
- Both derived from `STYLES` imported from `_mapping` module

### Core Functions
- `get_style_by_name(name)` (L24-53): Primary style resolver that:
  - First checks built-in styles via `_STYLE_NAME_TO_MODULE_MAP`
  - Falls back to plugin discovery via `find_plugin_styles()`
  - Attempts dynamic module loading for styles dropped into the styles package
  - Raises `ClassNotFound` for missing styles or classes
- `get_all_styles()` (L56-61): Generator yielding all available style names from both built-in and plugin sources

## Dependencies
- `find_plugin_styles` from `pygments.plugin`: Plugin discovery mechanism
- `ClassNotFound` from `pygments.util`: Exception for missing styles/classes
- `STYLES` from `pygments.styles._mapping`: Central registry of built-in styles

## Architecture Patterns
- **Fallback Resolution Chain**: Built-in → Plugin → Dynamic discovery
- **Lazy Loading**: Styles are imported only when requested
- **Dual Source Support**: Seamlessly handles both built-in and external plugin styles
- **Error Handling**: Comprehensive error reporting with context about builtin vs. plugin styles

## Critical Behavior
- Style name resolution is case-sensitive
- Dynamic style discovery expects `{name.title()}Style` class naming convention
- Plugin styles take precedence over dynamic discovery but not over built-ins
- Import errors are caught and converted to domain-specific `ClassNotFound` exceptions
